summary.para: Adds an image or images to an image list.

param.name: hbmImage
param.para: Type: HBITMAP
A handle to the bitmap that contains the image or images. The number of images is inferred from the width of the bitmap.

param.name: hbmMask
param.para: Type: HBITMAP
A handle to the bitmap that contains the mask. If no mask is used with the image list, this parameter is ignored.

param.name: pi
param.para: Type: int*
When this method returns, contains a pointer to the index of the first new image. If the method fails to successfully add the new image, this value is -1.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: IImageList.Add copies the bitmap to an internal data structure. You must use the function to delete hbmImage and hbmMask after the method returns.
To use IImageList.Add, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Adds an image or images to an image list, generating a mask from the specified bitmap.

param.name: hbmImage
param.para: Type: HBITMAP
A handle to the bitmap that contains one or more images. The number of images is inferred from the width of the bitmap.

param.name: crMask
param.para: Type: COLORREF

The color used to generate the mask. Each pixel of this color in the specified bitmap is changed to black, and the corresponding bit in the mask is set to 1. If this parameter is CLR_DEFAULT, then the color of the pixel at (0,0) is used as the mask.

param.name: pi
param.para: Type: int*
A pointer to an int that contains the index of the first new image when it returns, if successful, or -1 otherwise.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Note The bitmap passed in hbmImage will be modified.

IImageList.AddMasked copies the bitmap to an internal data structure. Bitmaps with color depth greater than 8bpp are not supported. You must use the function to delete hbmImage and crMask after the method returns.
To use IImageList.AddMasked, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Begins dragging an image.

param.name: iTrack
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the index of the image to drag.

param.name: dxHotspot
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the x-component of the drag position relative to the upper-left corner of the image.

param.name: dyHotspot
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the y-component of the drag position relative to the upper-left corner of the image.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: IImageList.BeginDrag creates a temporary image list that is used for dragging. In response to subsequent WM_MOUSEMOVE messages, you can move the drag image by using . To end the drag operation, you can use .
To use IImageList.BeginDrag, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Clones an existing image list.

param.name: riid
param.para: Type: REFIID
An IID for the new image list.

param.name: ppv
param.para: Type: PVOID*
The address of a pointer to the interface for the new image list.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To use IImageList.Clone, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Copies images from a given image list.

param.name: iDst
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the zero-based index of the destination image for the copy operation.

param.name: punkSrc
param.para: Type: *
A pointer to the interface for the source image list.

param.name: iSrc
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the zero-based index of the source image for the copy operation.

param.name: uFlags
param.para: Type: UINT
A value that specifies the type of copy operation to be made.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The uFlags parameter can have the following values.

item.description: The source image is copied to the destination image's index. This operation results in multiple instances of a given image.
The source and destination images exchange positions within the image list.

remarks.para: To use IImageList.Copy, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Locks updates to the specified window during a drag operation and displays the drag image at the specified position within the window.

param.name: hwndLock
param.para: Type: HWND
A handle to the window that owns the drag image.

param.name: x
param.para: Type: int
The x-coordinate at which to display the drag image. The coordinate is relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area.

param.name: y
param.para: Type: int
The y-coordinate at which to display the drag image. The coordinate is relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To begin a drag operation, use .
To use IImageList.DragEnter, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Unlocks the specified window and hides the drag image, which enables the window to update.

param.name: hwndLock
param.para: Type: HWND
A handle to the window that contains the drag image.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To use IImageList.DragLeave, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Moves the image that is being dragged during a drag-and-drop operation. This function is typically called in response to a WM_MOUSEMOVE message.

param.name: x
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the x-coordinate where the drag image appears. The coordinate is relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area.

param.name: y
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the y-coordinate where the drag image appears. The coordinate is relative to the upper-left corner of the window, not the client area.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To begin a drag operation, use the method.
To use IImageList.DragMove, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Shows or hides the image being dragged.

param.name: fShow
param.para: Type: BOOL
A value that specifies whether to show or hide the image being dragged. Specify TRUE to show the image or FALSE to hide the image.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To use IImageList.DragShowNolock, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Draws an image list item in the specified device context.

param.name: pimldp
param.para: Type: *
A pointer to an structure that contains the drawing parameters.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Overlay images draw transparently over the primary image specified in the i parameter of . You specify an overlay image in the fStyle, parameter of IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS using the macro to shift the one-based index of the overlay image. Use the OR operator to combine the macro's return value with the drawing style flags specified in fStyle. You must first specify this image as an overlay image by using .
To use IImageList.Draw, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Ends a drag operation.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To use IImageList.EndDrag, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Gets the current background color for an image list.

param.name: pclr
param.para: Type: COLORREF*
A pointer to a COLORREF that contains the background color when the method returns.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To use IImageList.GetBkColor, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Gets the temporary image list that is used for the drag image. The function also retrieves the current drag position and the offset of the drag image relative to the drag position.

param.name: ppt
param.para: Type: POINT*
A pointer to a POINT structure that receives the current drag position. Can be NULL.

param.name: pptHotspot
param.para: Type: POINT*
A pointer to a POINT structure that receives the offset of the drag image relative to the drag position. Can be NULL.

param.name: riid
param.para: Type: REFIID
An IID for the image list.

param.name: ppv
param.para: Type: PVOID*
The address of a pointer to the interface for the image list if successful, NULL otherwise.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The temporary image list is destroyed when is called. To begin a drag operation, use .
To use IImageList.GetDragImage, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Creates an icon from an image and a mask in an image list.

param.name: i
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the index of the image.

param.name: flags
param.para: Type: UINT
A combination of flags that specify the drawing style. For a list of values, see .

param.name: picon
param.para: Type: HICON*
A pointer to an int that contains the handle to the icon if successful, or NULL if otherwise.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The calling application must destroy the icon returned from this method using .
To use IImageList.GetIcon, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Gets the dimensions of images in an image list. All images in an image list have the same dimensions.

param.name: cx
param.para: Type: int*
A pointer to an int that receives the width, in pixels, of each image.

param.name: cy
param.para: Type: int*
A pointer to an int that receives the height, in pixels, of each image.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To use IImageList.GetIconSize, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Gets the number of images in an image list.

param.name: pi
param.para: Type: int*
A pointer to an int that contains the number of images when the method returns.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To use IImageList.GetImageCount, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Gets information about an image.

param.name: i
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the index of the image.

param.name: pImageInfo
param.para: Type: *
A pointer to an structure that receives information about the image. The information in this structure can directly manipulate the bitmaps of the image.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To use IImageList.GetImageInfo, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Gets an image's bounding rectangle.

param.name: i
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the index of the image.

param.name: prc
param.para: Type: *
A pointer to a RECT that contains the bounding rectangle when the method returns.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To use IImageList.GetImageRect, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Gets the flags of an image.

param.name: i
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the index of the images whose flags need to be retrieved.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Type: DWORD*
A pointer to a DWORD that contains the flags when the method returns. One of the following values:

description.para: Indicates that the item in the imagelist has an alpha channel.

item.description: Windows Vista and later. Indicates that the item in the imagelist was generated via a StretchBlt function, consequently image quality may have degraded.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To use IImageList.GetItemFlags, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Retrieves a specified image from the list of images used as overlay masks.

param.name: iOverlay
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the one-based index of the overlay mask.

param.name: piIndex
param.para: Type: int*
A pointer to an int that receives the zero-based index of an image in the image list. This index identifies the image that is used as an overlay mask.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To use IImageList.GetOverlayImage, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Creates a new image by combining two existing images. This method also creates a new image list in which to store the image.

param.name: i1
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the index of the first existing image.

param.name: punk2
param.para: Type: *
A pointer to the interface of the image list that contains the second image.

param.name: i2
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the index of the second existing image.

param.name: dx
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the x-component of the offset of the second image relative to the first image.

param.name: dy
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the y-component of the offset of the second image relative to the first image.

param.name: riid
param.para: Type: REFIID
An IID of the interface for the new image list.

param.name: ppv
param.para: Type: PVOID*
A raw pointer to the interface for the new image list.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The new image consists of the second image drawn transparently over the first. The mask for the new image is obtained by combining the masks of the two existing images with the bitwise OR operator.
To use IImageList.Merge, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Removes an image from an image list.

param.name: i
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the index of the image to remove. If this parameter is -1, the method removes all images.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: When an image is removed, the indexes of the remaining images adjust so that they always range from zero to one less than the number of images in the image list. For example, if you remove the image at index 0, then image 1 becomes image 0, image 2 becomes image 1, and so on.
To use IImageList.Remove, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Replaces an image in an image list with a new image.

param.name: i
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the index of the image to replace.

param.name: hbmImage
param.para: Type: HBITMAP
A handle to the bitmap that contains the image.

param.name: hbmMask
param.para: Type: HBITMAP
A handle to the bitmap that contains the mask. If no mask is used with the image list, this parameter is ignored.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: IImageList.Replace copies the bitmap to an internal data structure. You must use to delete hbmImage and hbmMask after the method returns.
To use IImageList.Replace, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Replaces an image with an icon or cursor.

param.name: i
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the index of the image to replace. If i is -1, the function adds the image to the end of the list.

param.name: hicon
param.para: Type: HICON
A handle to the icon or cursor that contains the bitmap and mask for the new image.

param.name: pi
param.para: Type: int*
A pointer to an int that will contain the index of the image on return if successful, or -1 otherwise.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Because the system does not save hicon, you can destroy it after the function returns if the icon or cursor was created by . You do not need to destroy hicon if it was loaded by the function; the system automatically frees an icon resource when it is no longer needed.
To use IImageList.ReplaceIcon, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Sets the background color for an image list. This method only functions if you add an icon to the image list or use the method to add a black and white bitmap. Without a mask, the entire image draws, and the background color is not visible.

param.name: clrBk
param.para: Type: COLORREF
The background color to set. If this parameter is set to CLR_NONE, then images draw transparently using the .

param.name: pclr
param.para: Type: COLORREF*
A pointer to a COLORREF that contains the previous background color on return if successful, or CLR_NONE otherwise.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To use IImageList.SetBkColor, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Creates a new drag image by combining the specified image, which is typically a mouse cursor image, with the current drag image.

param.name: punk
param.para: Type: *
A pointer to the interface that accesses the image list interface, which contains the new image to combine with the drag image.

param.name: iDrag
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the index of the new image to combine with the drag image.

param.name: dxHotspot
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the x-component of the hot spot within the new image.

param.name: dyHotspot
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the x-component of the hot spot within the new image.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To use IImageList.SetDragCursorImage, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Sets the dimensions of images in an image list and removes all images from the list.

param.name: cx
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the width, in pixels, of the images in the image list. All images in an image list have the same dimensions.

param.name: cy
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the height, in pixels, of the images in the image list. All images in an image list have the same dimensions.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: To use IImageList.SetIconSize, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Resizes an existing image list.

param.name: uNewCount
param.para: Type: UINT
A value that specifies the new size of the image list.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If an application expands an image list using this method, it must add new images by using . If the application does not add valid images to the new indexes, draw operations that use the new indexes are unpredictable.

If you decrease the size of an image list using this method, images at the end of the list for which there is no longer room are truncated from the list. Images truncated in this manner are automatically deallocated.
To use IImageList.SetImageCount, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Adds a specified image to the list of images used as overlay masks. An image list can have up to four overlay masks in Common Controls version 4.70 and earlier, and up to 15 in version 4.71 or later. The method assigns an overlay mask index to the specified image.

param.name: iImage
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the zero-based index of an image in the image list. This index identifies the image to use as an overlay mask.

param.name: iOverlay
param.para: Type: int
A value of type int that contains the one-based index of the overlay mask.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: An overlay mask is an image drawn transparently over another image. To draw an overlay mask over an image, call . The fStyle parameter of these functions can use the macro to specify an overlay mask index.
A call to this method fails and returns E_INVALIDARG unless the image list is created using a mask.
To use IImageList.SetOverlayImage, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

summary.para: Exposes methods that manipulate and interact with image lists.

To use IImageList, specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in the manifest. If you do not do this, Comctl32.dll version 5 will be used by default, with which IImageList could display unpredictable behavior. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.
